intro: Furtadoa sumatrensis, commonly known as the Sumatran furtadoa, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. Its leaves are usually opposite and elliptical, with a smooth texture. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Furtadoa sumatrensis is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
